content.rendered:
Fall in Colorado is one of the least busy times of the season for tourism, but possibly one of the better times to visit.  With all the attention given to the winter and summer months, the best deals and weather are usually found during the fall season. The air is a bit cooler but with the monsoon season coming to an end and winter around the corner, fall decides to bring us some of the most beautiful colors seen west of the Mississippi. The aspen trees that line the hillsides have some of the most vibrant color changes of any trees and paints the mountains in beautiful reds, yellows, and oranges.  The mountains are truly ablaze with color.

One of the best way to experience fall in Colorado is to take a zipline tour.  The scenery is great from just about anywhere and is a totally different experience when you are flying through the trees and standing on top of canopies.  Located in Idaho Springs, our outpost is well equipped to provide a top tier experience.  Our Mountain Top Zipline Course offers panoramas of the surrounding areas including several of Colorado’s famous fourteeners.  Your tour will be an adrenaline filled rush that will provide excitement and memories for years to come.

Ziplining usually runs well into November so there is plenty of time to plan a trip and see all the amazing scenery.  Also, keep a lookout on our discounts page so you can get a great trip that is great for your wallet too!
